skill.name: dependency-updater
skill.description: Smart dependency update checker with changelog summaries and breaking change detection.
skill.summary: Smart dependency update checker with changelog summaries and breaking change detection.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only AI assistant instructions. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access capabilities. The skill provides guidance on dependency management through natural language processing only.

content.value_statement: Managing project dependencies is time-consuming and risky. Missing security updates or overlooking breaking changes can break production systems. This skill analyzes outdated dependencies, identifies security vulnerabilities, and provides prioritized recommendations with changelog summaries.
actual_capabilities: Scans dependency files (package.json, requirements.txt, go.mod, Cargo.toml, pom.xml)
Categorizes updates by version change type (patch, minor, major)
Identifies security vulnerabilities and CVEs in dependencies
Fetches and summarizes changelogs and release notes
Detects breaking changes and provides migration guidance
Generates prioritized update reports with risk assessments
limitations: Does not actually execute dependency updates or modify files
Does not install packages or run package managers
Does not access external vulnerability databases directly
Requires the AI to have network access for fetching changelogs

use_cases.title: Weekly dependency review
use_cases.description: Review all outdated dependencies and identify which ones need immediate security patches

use_cases.title: Security audit preparation
use_cases.description: Identify vulnerable dependencies before security audits or compliance checks

use_cases.title: Major version upgrade planning
use_cases.description: Plan safe major version upgrades by understanding breaking changes and migration requirements

prompt_templates.title: Major updates review
prompt_templates.scenario: Review breaking changes in major updates

prompt_templates.title: Specific file check
prompt_templates.scenario: Analyze dependencies in a specific file

best_practices: Run dependency updates in a separate branch and test thoroughly before merging
Review changelogs and migration guides before applying major version updates
Use --dry-run first to preview changes and assess impact before executing updates
anti_patterns: Updating all dependencies at once without reviewing changelogs
Skipping security updates for minor packages
Applying major version updates directly to production without testing

faq.question: What dependency file formats are supported?
faq.answer: Supports package.json (npm/yarn/pnpm), requirements.txt (Python), go.mod (Go), Cargo.toml (Rust), and pom.xml/build.gradle (Java).

faq.question: Does this skill actually update my dependencies?
faq.answer: No. This skill analyzes dependencies and provides recommendations. You must run the actual package manager commands to apply updates.

faq.question: How does the skill detect security vulnerabilities?
faq.answer: The AI assistant analyzes dependency versions against known vulnerability databases and advisories during the analysis process.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill that only reads dependency file content. No data is stored or transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why did my update fail after following the recommendations?
faq.answer: Changelogs may not cover all edge cases. Always test updates in a staging environment and check your test suite before production deployment.

faq.question: How is this different from Dependabot?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered analysis and explanations. Dependabot automates pull requests. Use both together for best results.
